titleStmt.title: Marks & Co. to Ephraim L. Van Winkle
CWG2267

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Louisville Ky, Nov, 23d 1865
To Hon, Secty State Ky
Frankfort Ky
Sir

Mr "James P Sharp" a Citizen of Louisville Kentucky is engaged in the claim Agency Business and desires a Commission as a Notary Public for the State at large, and if you issue said commission he also wants three Certificates from you that he is a Notary Public for the State at large which certificates he desires to file in three of the departments at Washington.
Inclosed you will find two Dollars to pay for the Commission, and if you will issue the other three certificates and forward them with the Commission send your bill for them also and we will pay it.
we are personally well acquainted with Mr -- Sharp and Know him to be an honest, trustworthy gentleman and every way qualified to fill the position he Seeks

We have the honor to be sir.
Your Obt, Svts
Marks & Co
Mr E --

Notary Public
Jefferson Co
Jas P. Sharp
apptd
25 Nov/65
